content.description: A great summit route with the crux at the top. Gain chimney from the N. Then chimney/stem your way up and forward placing gear where ever you can find it. Work on to S shoulder and pull the face bulge, protected by a bolt.
content.protection: Single rack to 4"   1 bolt   Bolted anchor
content.location: Scramble into chimney separating Spire One and Javelin. Belay from talus filled perch. One 70m rap will take you back to belay.

content.description: Very pleased with how this route turned out! Wander up NE face finding good gear and pulling well protected cruxes on excellent rock. Start the same as Gill Route from the talus perch. Place a piece right away then move out on to the face. Find your way to horizontal and prepare for the crux. Another smaller crux is near the top.
content.protection: Single rack to BD#2 & one #4 or #5   Nuts   5 Bolts   Bolted anchor
content.location: NE aspect of spire. 70m or double rope rap.

content.description: This is the slender spire spurring from Spire One. First summited by John Gill, Aug. 1964.
